ray.rage.game

Class AbstractGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.game.AbstractGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Manageable, Game
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseGame

    public abstract class AbstractGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game
    An abstract class with convenience protected methods to provide a basic logical structure to the steps needed for a game to set itself up, run, and clean up after itself. The method signatures provide strong hints to the user about what needs to be done during a particular step as well as what components are needed to accomplish it. This also means that the user is free to override specific parts with more granularity (e.g. choosing to load a different configuration.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Detail

      • startup

        protected abstract void startup(Engine engine)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Starts up the engine and then the game, in that order. It's the reverse order of shutdown(Engine).
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the configuration cannot be loaded.
        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(Configuration)

      • run

        protected abstract void run(Engine engine)
        Enters the main loop.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine.

      • update

        protected abstract void update(Engine engine)
        Allows the game to perform all necessary updates prior to rendering a frame.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine.

      • shutdown

        protected abstract void shutdown(Engine engine)
        Shuts down the game and then the engine, in that order. It's the reverse order of startup(Engine).
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine.

      • loadConfiguration

        protected abstract void loadConfiguration(Configuration config)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the game's configuration data from the specified source.
        Parameters:
        config - The configuration object that holds the data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the configuration cannot be loaded.

      • createRenderSystemFactory

        protected abstract RenderSystemFactory createRenderSystemFactory()
        Delegates creation of a factory responsible for the specific render-system implementation to the client.
        Returns:
        A factory that allows the framework to instantiate the render-system to be used.

      • setupGpuShaderPrograms

        protected abstract void setupGpuShaderPrograms(RenderSystem rs,
                                               ShaderManager sm)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        This is where the game's shader-programs are specified and built.
        Parameters:
        rs - The render-system that actually creates the shader-programs.
        sm - The shader-manager to retrieve the actual source code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the shader-manager cannot find the specified assets.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the at least one shader-program fails to build.

      • setupWindow

        protected abstract void setupWindow(RenderSystem rs,
                                    java.awt.GraphicsEnvironment ge)
        This is where the game creates its window based on its current environment, including whether it wants to be Full-Screen Exclusive Mode or not (default).
        Parameters:
        rs - The render-system that actually creates the render-windows with their proper drawing surface specifications and context.
        ge - The platform's graphics-environment.

      • setupWindowViewports

        protected abstract void setupWindowViewports(RenderWindow rw)
        This is where the game logically divides a render-window's real-estate into viewports. Most render-windows only need one (default).
        Parameters:
        rw - The render-window having its viewports set up.

      • createSceneManagerFactory

        protected abstract SceneManagerFactory createSceneManagerFactory()
        Delegates creation of a factory responsible for the specific scene-manager implementation to the client.
        Returns:
        A factory that allows the framework to instantiate the scene-manager to be used.

      • setupCameras

        protected abstract void setupCameras(SceneManager sm,
                                     RenderWindow rw)
        This is where the game creates cameras, connects them to scene-nodes, specifies into which viewports their contents will be drawn, and so on.
        Parameters:
        sm - The scene-manager used to create cameras, the scene-nodes to which they're attached, and so on.
        rw - The render-window containing the viewports into which a the scene-objects in the camera's field of view will be drawn.
        See Also:
        setupScene(Engine, SceneManager)

      • setupScene

        protected abstract void setupScene(Engine engine,
                                   SceneManager sm)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        This is where the game sets up a scene by creating entities, lights, and other scene-objects.

        Scene-objects must be connected to scene-nodes so that they can be positioned in the world and be considered to be part of the scene. Scene-nodes can (optionally) be added to node-controllers.

        Parameters:
        engine - The engine.
        sm - The scene-manager
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an asset-manager cannot find the specified assets in the file system.
